resources.string: Location features require access to the device\'s location.
Camera features require access to the device\'s camera.
Recording sound requires access to the device\'s microphone.
Importing files requires access to the device\'s files.
Exporting data requires access to the device\'s files.
Collecting data requires access to the device\'s files, microphone, and camera.
Creating sample files and directories requires access to the device\'s files.
Are you sure you want to delete this field? This will delete all data from this field.
Default, minimum, and maximum are required and must be numeric
Deleting a trait also deletes data that has been collected for that trait. Are you sure you want to delete this trait?
Field column type must be selected
Adds a tutorial icon to the collect, settings, fields, and traits screens
Adjust the number of Infobars displayed on the main screen
Changes middle section of main screen to the legacy Quick GoTo
Modify specific colors or the entire theme of Field Book
Change the default system colors of the app
Change how saved data is displayed
Reset all settings to the system default values
Modify default icons on the collect screen
Display values or labels on the collect screen
Map volume keys to entry navigation
Volume keys go to next or previous entry
Change how the return key signal is interpreted
After going through all traits, Field Book goes to the next entry
Disable entry navigation if no data
Notification sound when the primary order changes
Notification sound when traits are completely cycled through
Notification sound when moving between entries
Use day of year when collecting data instead of the date
Skips entries that have data for the active trait
Skip entries that have data for all traits
When files are exported, the share dialog will not be displayed
Scan barcode and move to the specific entry
Adds a button to the toolbar that jumps to the next entry with no data for the current trait
Opens dialog to input unique id and move to specific entry
Displays a spreadsheet of plots and traits showing collected data
Choose the root directory for Field Book
Your device does not contain the necessary hardware for this feature
Value is less than allowed minimum
Value is larger than allowed maximum
Are you sure you want to delete this photo?
Button that opens a calendar picker.
Would you like to enable the tutorial? This setting can be changed in the Settings.
InfoBars show extra data for each entry and can be changed using the dropdown menus.
The small, green arrows move between traits.
The current trait being collected. A list of active traits is displayed when the current trait is pressed.
The large, black arrows move between entries.
This is where the primary and secondary order are displayed.
Data is entered in the bottom area of the screen. Different trait types have different layouts.
The NA button is used to mark values as missing.
Data is deleted using this button.
The search icon allows database queries.
This displays a list of files in the Resources folder.
This displays a summary of all data for the current entry.
allows you to import and manage fields.
To start using Field Book, first import a field file.
allows you to add, import, and manage traits.
allows you to collect phenotypic data.
allows you to set the person and location.
allows additional configuration for data collection.
Data can be exported in two formats: database or table.
Files must contain three columns: a unique identifier, a primary order, and a secondary order. The primary/secondary order are used for navigation in the field.
A field is selected for data collection after being imported.
To delete a field, open the menu on the left side of a field name and select Delete.
Add Trait creates a new trait. Different trait formats have different collection layouts.
To import a premade list of traits, choose Import on the toolbar.
Different trait formats are indicated with different icons.
Traits can be disabled from collection by toggling the checkbox.

Irazema Fuentes-Bueno, Sandra Dunckel, Shuangye Wu, Narinder Singh, Daljit Singh, Erena Edae, Tatiana Danilova, Rodrigo Pedrozo, Cristiano Lemes da Silva, Sophie Bouchet, Hiroyoshi Iwata, Goro Ishikawa, Khaled El-Shamaa, Mokhlesur Rahman, Alice Brunazzi

Development of Field Book has been supported by the Collaborative Crop Research Program of The McKnight Foundation, the National Science Foundation (#1543958), and the National Institute of Food and Agriculture (#2019-67021-29931).
All data will be deleted. Are you sure you want to reset the database?
A database reset cannot be reversed. The app will quit after clearing the database. Are you really sure you want to continue?
Unique identifier column contains duplicates or has already been used in a different file
This file type is not currently supported
Column names contain illegal characters or words:
Column names contain illegal characters that will be replaced during import.
Column name in imported file cannot be:
Selected column contains characters which cannot be used in the unique identifier
Columns cannot be used for the same assignment
Only CSV and XLS files can be imported as a field
Only TRT files can be imported as a trait list
Cannot delete synced BrAPI observation, using NA instead
A field must be imported before traits can be created.
No field is currently loaded. Please load a field before collecting data.
No traits exist. Please create traits before collecting data.
If you utilize Field Book for research, please cite the following journal article:
Rife, T.W., and J.A. Poland. 2014. Field Book: An Open-Source Application for Field Data Collection on Android. Crop Sci. 54(4): 1624–1627.
The base URL for the connected BrAPI server
The location of the OIDC Discovery JSON document
ERROR: You do not have the permissions necessary to perform this action
ERROR: Target system does not support this operation via BrAPI.
Error when loading study details for study. Study not saved.
Error when loading plots for study. Study not saved.
Error when loading traits for study. Study not saved.
Selected Field Must Be Imported From BrAPI.
Must configure a valid BrAPI URL in settings before proceeding
ERROR: You do not have the permissions to send data to the specified system.
ERROR: Target system does not support sending observations via BrAPI.
ERROR: Response number of observations different from request
Unable to sync data. Field data originates from, %1$s, BrAPI url currently set to %2$s. Sources must match.
Error saving traits. No traits were saved.
Error saving some traits. Some traits were not saved
Device Offline: Please connect to a network and try again

You need to be logged into the system you are attempting to sync data with in order to sync your data.
Would you like to authenticate now?
Traits and fields imported via BrAPI will be able to export their observations via the BrAPI export. Traits and fields created manually or imported via CSV will need to be exported via CSV format.
Successfully fetched traits. %1$d traits ignored because of missing brapi \'trait\' field
This BrAPI study is currently incompatible with Field Book. Studies must include row and column in the header.
Button which navigates to Zebra Connect app.
Button which prints labels configured in this dialog.
Unable to print label. Make sure the PrintConnect app is installed and connected to your Zebra printer.
Do you want to save the name of the person collecting data?
Shows a dialog every 24 hours, verifying the person\'s name.
Please choose a field name and size.
Please choose a field starting point.
Please enter a valid name and format.
Large Field Detected, transaction might take a long time.
Button to choose linear plot pattern.
Button to choose zig zag plot pattern.
Image showing orientation and plot pattern.
An error occurred when backing up v8 database.
Please pair a device before collecting data.
Swaps the trait and plot arrow functions
Enables usage of device location to navigate fields.
GeoNav creates a trapezoid in front of the user, the angle closest to the user is defined as %s°.
The time between location updates is %ss.
Interference detected, the compass might not be accurate
No field book directories could be found.
Import file has no suitable columns to choose from.
The selected study has empty unique, primary, or secondary names.
Choose bluetooth device to print from.
When enabled the user can point at plots relative to their position to select them. When disabled the selection is based on distance.
Write GeoNav steps to a log file in \n storage/geonav/log.txt
Field Book could not load the file.
Counter failed to save, please recreate this trait.
This will change what is displayed on the left-most column of the data grid.
This study has no plots saved.
You have entered an http url. There is no guarantee that this connection is secure.
The %s method used to search for plots in GeoNav.
The shorter base of the trapezoid is %s km.
The distance from the user to the opposite end of the trapezoid is %s km.
An error occurred during file load.
Failed to create field data for line %d in file.
Bundle media data with export file.
You have a saved coordinate for this unit, are you sure you want to update it?
Please wait while the incoming locations are being averaged…
